dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 2660 IH: Trauma Relief Access for Universal Medical Assistance Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Rush (for himself, Mr. Ruppersberger, Mr. Enyart, Mr. Nadler, and Mr. Danny K. Davis of Illinois) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Appropriations

form.official-title: Making supplemental appropriations for the Department of Health and Human Services for awarding grants to States to promote universal access to trauma care services provided by trauma centers and trauma-related physician specialties.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Trauma Relief Access for Universal Medical Assistance Act.

section.header: Supplemental appropriations for trauma service availability
section.text: There is hereby appropriated to the Department of Health and Human Services, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, for an additional amount for the purpose of carrying out part H of title XII of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 300dâ€“81 et seq.; relating to grants to States to promote universal access to trauma care services provided by trauma centers and trauma-related physician specialties), a total of $100,000,000 for the period of fiscal years 2014 through 2018.
